forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly clear, with a low around 56. North wind around 23 mph, with gusts as high as 35 mph.

forecast.name: Wednesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 68, with temperatures falling to around 64 in the afternoon. North northeast wind 10 to 21 mph, with gusts as high as 35 mph.

weather_report:
In the early hours of this Wednesday, Downtown San Francisco emerges beneath a wide expanse of clarity, the remnants of nightfall hanging softly in the corners of the sky. The chill of a low around fifty-six whispers through the streets, while a gentle north wind stirs at a brisk twenty-three miles per hour, with occasional gusts reminding one of the city’s spirited nature. As dawn breaks, a sunlit promise begins to unfold, heralding a daytime high of nearly sixty-eight, which will settle into a comfortable sixty-four as afternoon approaches.

The atmosphere, free of fog’s usual embrace, reveals clear vistas towards the majestic Golden Gate Bridge, where flashes of sunlight dance across the water, coaxing the fog back into the horizon. This scene invites the thoughtful wanderer to don layers—perhaps a light jacket over a simple shirt—to navigate the cool air of the morning and welcome the warming rays of midday. A day such as this is best spent wandering local markets, perusing independent bookstores, or simply enjoying a long stroll along the Embarcadero, where the pulse of the city meets the soothing rhythm of the Bay.
